events.body:
Boost 1.81.0 has been just [released](https://github.com/boostorg/boost/releases/tag/boost-1.81.0). So this PR is ready to review.

cc @fanquake @jarolrod @Sjors
The PR description has been updated with Guix build hashes.

guix hashes 

```
find guix-build-$(git rev-parse --short=12 HEAD)/output/ -type f -print0 | env LC_ALL=C sort -z | xargs -r0 sha256sum
```

Changes in the boost modules included in bitcoin

https://github.com/boostorg/signals2/compare/boost-1.80.0...boost-1.81.0
  - Use core/noncopyable instead of boost/noncopyable. Appears a simple refactor

https://github.com/boostorg/multi_index/compare/boost-1.80.0...boost-1.81.0
  - Use core/enable_if. Appears to be filename refactor
  - Documentation changes

https://github.com/boostorg/date_time/compare/boost-1.80.0...boost-1.81.0
  - Documentation changes
  - Minor comment changes
  - Small function rename
  - Extract helper function refactor

https://github.com/boostorg/test/compare/boost-1.80.0...boost-1.81.0
  - No changes

https://github.com/boostorg/process/compare/boost-1.80.0...boost-1.81.0
  - hebasto fixes compiling error for MinGW-w64
  - No changes to pipe.hpp or io.hpp which appear to be the only pieces bitcoin code uses

tACK e8b4201ba2fd7745edc26543704d2b4a51dbb151

Did some light external signer testing on an Intel Mac and Ubuntu 22.10 with both the self-built and Guix build.

~~ACK e8b4201ba2fd7745edc26543704d2b4a51dbb151~~

@johnny9 Thanks for actually checking the changes between versions here. Most of them are mundane things (some that that we've upstreamed). However looing at the changes to our core Boost modules is much more important that Boost Process (external signer) when updating our version used in depends.
This is missing the version update to dependencies.md.
